Grains disaccate, total span (based on 64 measured specimens) 60"m (cid:173)
110"m. Corpus longer than wide (polar view), ratio lenght to width greater
than 5 - 4. Lenght of corpus 38"m - 76"m. Co/pus (observed in well
preserved, suitably oriented specimens) extending full length of corpus. Sacci
not or scarcely overlapping on to proximal surface, roots of sacci markedly
offset distally. Sacci as deep as corpus , or a litlle less. Ornament on sacci:
brochi about 3"m in diameter, muri about 1 micron wide. Ornament on
corpus indistict to faintly reticulate. Corpus and sacci without marked thickening, light yellow to brownish yellow,
Eixo longitudinal do corpo central: 38" m - 78"m.
Esta espécie distingue-se das demais descritas para o gênero pela presença de um sulco. Foster (1979) registrou
formas de A. australis no Permiano da Austrâlia, Bacia de Sydney.

1975: Cannanoropollis sp. cf. C. korbaensis (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) Foster
Pollen monosaccate, trilete. Amb circular to broadly oval, periphery
undulant. Laesurae distinct to perceptible, simple extending up to 1/2
of distance to corpus margin. Corpus circular to oval (polar view),
outline distinct; undetached exoexine of corpus infrareticulate, thin,
without marked folds or wrinkles; intexine smooth, 1" m - 2"m thick.
Saccus detached subequatorially from distai and proximal faces: line
of detachment irregular. Detached exoexine overlapping outer 114-1/2
corpus radius. Saccus 2"m - 3"m thick, occasionally with strong
radial folds; infrareticu/um fine, dense ly packed.
A espécie C. korbaensis é similar a C. sp, cf. C. korbaensis de (Bharadwaj & Tiwari) Foster 1975. As espécies
registradas na Bacia do Paraná são similares a Parasaccites korbaensis Bharadwaj & Tiwari 1964. De acordo com
os critérios de Foster (1975), enquadra-se no gênero Cannanoropollis e não em Parasa ccites.
Locus typicus: Setor Gho rdewa (poço nOG-101) Mina Korba, India.

Laesurate; fissures vary in number and formo A circular groove
encloses the fissured portion of lhe body. Diameter of area enclosed
by groove equals about 3/4 of the body width and is a few " m shorter
than the body length. At least one fissure is present, in which case it
is median, longitudinal and extends to the groove; the fissure may
bifurcate to produce triradiate and other forms. Other fissures may be
present; they are usually longitudinal and extend to the groove.
evident in well preserved specimens. Distai furrow distinct; body usually lacks folds. Sacci crescen t-shaped (Ienghl:
width about 1:2); maximum saccus width measured along the distai line of attachment is slightly less than body
width. In polar view, area of one saccus equals 213 • 3/4 body area. Very mild distai inclination; furrow width variable.
Sacci internally reticulate; distai meshes isodiametric, proximal muri strongly radially aligned.
A espécie é caracterizada pela presença do sulco circular envolvendo o corpo, pela forma dos sacos e a disposiçâo
assimétrica das estrias, sendo muito similar a lfIinitas unicus Kosanke 1950.

Spores radial, trilete; amb convexly subtriangular. Laesurae straight or

so. Prominent biform sculpture developed over whole of distai surface,

on cingulate proximal face. Sculpture consists of coarse mammoi d verrucae

sinuous ridge-like structures up to ca. 25" m long (usually much less).

1"m - 6.5" m high. Exine otherwise scabrate or finely, irregularly pitled (presumed corros ion ellect). Intexinal body
often evident, but only vaguely; usually in close proximity to outer layer.

cingulizone and corpus is marked by small vacuoles.

Pollen gra ins bilateral, oval to circular in polar view; centra l body
sphe rical, not discern ible in many cases in dista i polar view, distinct
whe n view ed in lateral oblique, and proximal polar positions; exposed
portions of cent ral body laevigate to finely granulose; sacc us oval to
infrareticulate, enveloping the central body in equatorial region, proximal
cap and sulcus area free, saccus distally inclined in oblique and lateral
compressions; sulcus fusiform or irregular in outline, extending almost
across central body at right angles to the long axis of the grain.
Eixo longitudinal do saco : S" m - 30;<m.
O gênero Vesicaspora tem sido conside rado por diversos autores como pólen bissacado (Alpern, 1959; Hart,
1960). Entretanto, Schemel (1951) considerou em sua desc rição esse gênero como monossacado. Qua ndo o
pólen estâ em orientaçã o oblíqua ou lateral, pode ocorrer a impressão de um grão bissacado. Wilson &
Venkatachala (1963) observ aram que Schemel (195 1) não designou um holótipo, da i a razão da emenda.
